text: Nostalgic traditional Teochew kueh at Bukit Merah. The tapioca kueh ($4) was amazingly soft. This looks like a branch of a stall with the same name in Alexandra Village.

Honestly not good. I know there are many loyal fans out there sorry. Bought 4 flavours of ang ku kueh (bean, peanut, sesame, yam) and how is it that all of them- skin too thick, feels like it was kept for a few days already, and the filling were all bland and lacklustre. Bean, yam and sesame all roughly tasted the same. And the peanut tasted ÊºèÈ£é. $1.30/piece

Bought the mini ku chai kueh too, again the skin was so thick that we felt that we ate more skin than filling. ÔºÑ6.50 for 6 mini pieces.
Had a salted bean ang ku kueh. Skin too thick and filling was tasteless. You could not pay me to eat from this stall again.

Traditional kuehs ! ‚Äã‚ÄãMy daughter's favorite Ang Ku Kueh stall ! Especially their peanuts & durians . Hardworking & friendly owner . Absolutely authentic & traditional hand made .So many different types to choose from. Must try and support if not all these traditional food & skills of making them will be lost ! Closed on Monday & Thursday.
Kung Fu skills! I hope not to be eliminated by this ruthless and indifferent high-tech era and the fate of no successors! We must pass it on!
